<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 616, 92]]<|/det|>
Some IGCSE students are investigating the cooling of water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 475, 122]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 451, 841, 470]]<|/det|>
A thermometer is placed on the bench so that room temperature can be measured.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 482, 816, 502]]<|/det|>
Read and record room temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{R}}\) as shown on the thermometer in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[598, 515, 875, 535]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 648, 824, 668]]<|/det|>
A student pours hot water into the beaker so that the level is as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 680, 875, 714]]<|/det|>
In Table 1.1, he then records the temperatures \(\theta\) every minute as the water cools until time \(t = 6\) minutes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 726, 771, 745]]<|/det|>

<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 635, 91]]<|/det|>
The IGCSE class is investigating the oscillation of a pendulum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 489, 122]]<|/det|>
The apparatus is set up as shown in Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[207, 131, 735, 390]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[326, 408, 393, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[579, 408, 650, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 440, 764, 460]]<|/det|>
The height \(h\) of the pendulum bob above the bench is measured and recorded.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 472, 875, 507]]<|/det|>
This is repeated, to obtain a total of five different values of \(h\), by shortening the string of the pendulum but without changing the height of the clamp.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 518, 875, 553]]<|/det|>
For each value of \(h\), the pendulum bob is pulled to one side by a small distance, as shown in Fig. 2.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 565, 875, 599]]<|/det|>
The pendulum is then released and the time \(t\) for 10 complete oscillations is measured and recorded.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 612, 144, 630]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 612, 875, 645]]<|/det|>
Describe a precaution which the IGCSE students might have taken in order to measure \(h\) as accurately as possible. You may draw a diagram.

<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 808, 109]]<|/det|>
Students in the IGCSE class are investigating the resistance of electric circuits with branches.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 551, 138]]<|/det|>
The apparatus has been set up as shown in Fig. 3.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[171, 147, 831, 413]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 490, 509, 509]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 3.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 520, 875, 556]]<|/det|>
The current in the circuit and the potential difference across the combination of lamps connected between \(\mathbf{A}\) and \(\mathbf{B}\) are to be measured.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 568, 144, 587]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 875, 603]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 600, 875, 618]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 823, 107]]<|/det|> The values of potential difference \(V\) across AB and current \(I\) for circuit 1 are in Table 3.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 880, 153]]<|/det|> The lamps are then reconnected as shown in Fig. 3.2 and then Fig. 3.3 and the experiment is repeated. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[212, 163, 730, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 395, 512, 413]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 425, 730, 631]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 650, 512, 668]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 681, 183, 700]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 681, 875, 720]]<|/det|> Calculate, and record in the table, the total resistance \(R\) of each combination of lamps, using the equation \(R = \frac{V}{I}\) . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 713, 876, 732]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 744, 181, 763]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 744, 554, 763]]<|/det|> Complete the column headings in the table. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 744, 876, 763]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 775, 517, 794]]<|/det|> Table 3.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 806, 870, 926]]<|/det|>
circuit\(V/\)\(I/\)\(R/\)

21.760.22
31.720.44

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 824, 107]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 710, 92]]<|/det|>
